info.title: Akamai: Edge DNS API

post.description: Creates a new change list based on the most recent version of a zone. No POST body is needed, since the object is read-only.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS API

parameters.description: The name of an Edge DNS zone.
parameters.name: zone

parameters.description: __Enum__ You can't create a change list if you've already created one for this zone. The default `none` raises an error if a change list exists. Use `any` to delete any existing change lists before running the create operation. Use `stale` to automatically delete stale change lists before running the create operation. The `stale` option raises an error if there's a change list attached to the current version.
parameters.name: overwrite

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 date indicating the last time the change list was modified.

stale.description: If the parent version isn't current, this change list is stale.

zoneVersionId.description: The zone version identifier for the parent version of this change list.

schema.description: A report on the difference between two zone versions or a version and a change list.

diffs.description: Collections of differences between the two versions.

recordSetDiffs.description: Record sets that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a record set between two versions.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value doesn't exist on an `ADD` difference.

name.description: The name of the record set that changed.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference contains the `toValue` but not a `fromValue`. A `DELETE` difference is the other way around. An `EDIT` difference has both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value doesn't exist on an `DELETE` difference.

type.description: The type of the record set that changed.

settingsDiffs.description: Settings fields that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a settings value between two versions.

fieldName.description: The name of the settings value that changed.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value isn't present for an `ADD` difference.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference contains the `toValue` and a `DELETE` difference contains a `fromValue`. An `EDIT` difference contains both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value isn't present for a `DELETE` difference.

metadata.description: Metadata about this diff report, describing the versions being diffed.

fromVersionId.description: The version ID of the base version.

fromVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the base version was last modified.

toVersionId.description: The version ID of the new version or change list.

toVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the new change list version was last modified.

rdata.description: Data strings, representing multiple records within a set. The format of the `rdata` strings depend on the `type` of this record. Not used When the `op` value for the PATCH request is DELETE.

state.description: The state of this record in the change list. A `PRISTINE` record hasn't been changed, otherwise it has been `ADDED`, `EDITED`, or `DELETED`.

ttl.description: The number of seconds that this record should live in a resolver's cache before being refetched. Not used When the `op` value for the PATCH request is DELETE.

get.description: Retrieves the current list of record sets based on the selected change list. The record sets returned reflect any Changes added to this change list. This call works even if the change list is stale. This operation is (paginated](ref:use-pagination).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS API

parameters.description: Sorts the list on the specified fields. You can specify multiple fields as a comma-separated list. Placing a dash before a field name sorts it in descending order. Allowed fields include `name` and `type`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Displays only record sets that match one of the provided types. Specifies multiple fields as a comma-separated list. Ignores illegal or disallowed record types.
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Displays only record sets whose NAME or RDATA field matches this value. The entire record set, that is all records with the same name and type are shown if any record in the set has a NAME or RDATA that matches the value case-insensitively.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Which page of results to return. The first page is page `1`, the default value.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of results per page to return, `25` by default.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Disables paging and shows the entire list all at once, `false` by default. Using this parameter may significantly increase the time required to respond to the request.
parameters.name: showAll

schema.description: An Edge DNS zone. This object contains zone settings, but not record sets.

activationState.description: The current status of zone activation, either `NEW`, `PENDING_APPROVAL`, `ACTIVE`, `OBSOLETE`, `LOCKED`, or `ERROR`.

aliasCount.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. The number of zones of type `ALIAS` that point to this zone.

endCustomerId.description: Free-form user identifier for this zone, often used by resellers.

lastActivationDate.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the latest version was activated.

lastModifiedBy.description: The name of the user that last edited this zone.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the zone was last modified.

masters.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The names or addresses of the customer's name servers from which the zone data should be retrieved.

signAndServe.description: Whether DNSSEC Sign&Serve is enabled. Applies to `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only.

signAndServeAlgorithm.description: The algorithm currently or last used for DNSSEC Sign&Serve, either `RSA_SHA1`, `RSA_SHA256`, `RSA_SHA512`, `ECDSA_P256_SHA256`, or `ECDSA_P384_SHA384`. Absent if no algorithm has ever been assigned to this zone.

subzoneGrants.description: Determines if cross-account subzones are enabled. This doesn't impact the ability to create subzones that you're presently authorized to edit.

target.description: For `ALIAS` zones only. The name of the zone whose configuration this zone copies.

tsigKey.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The TSIG key used for zone transfers.

algorithm.description: The algorithm used to encode the TSIG key's secret data. Possible values are: `hmac-md5`, `hmac-sha1`, `hmac-sha224`, `hmac-sha256`, `hmac-sha384`, `hmac-sha512`, or `HMAC-MD5.SIG-ALG.REG.INT`.

name.description: The name of the TSIG key. This is a name that's unique across all of Akamai's customers. Since the key name is treated like a DNS name, the value is lowercase and the server removes any trailing dots.

secret.description: A Base64-encoded string of data. When decoded, it needs to contain the correct number of bits for the chosen algorithm. If the input isn't correctly padded, the server applies the padding.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

type.description: The zone type. A `PRIMARY` zone's records are stored in Control Center. A `SECONDARY` zone's records are stored on the customer's name servers. `ALIAS` zones allow users to duplicate the configuration of an existing zone.

versionId.description: The UUID of the most recently activated version. You can use this value as an `ETag` when performing operations that affect zones.

put.description: Updates the change list with new Zone settings. The entire Zone object is needed no matter how many fields you're updating.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS API

schema.description: A report of TSIG keys available to you.

keys.description: This block contains a list of keys that matched the request.

items.description: A TSIG key.

algorithm.description: The algorithm used to encode the TSIG key's secret data. Possible values are: `hmac-md5`, `hmac-sha1`, `hmac-sha224`, `hmac-sha256`, `hmac-sha384`, `hmac-sha512`, or `HMAC-MD5.SIG-ALG.REG.INT`.

name.description: The name of the TSIG key. This is a name that's unique across all of Akamai's customers. Since the key name is treated like a DNS name, the value is lowercase and the server removes any trailing dots.

secret.description: A Base64-encoded string of data. When decoded, it needs to contain the correct number of bits for the chosen algorithm. If the input isn't correctly padded, the server applies the padding.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

sortBy.description: If the `sortBy` parameter was passed in, this field contains a list of the sorting fields.

totalElements.description: The total number of TSIG keys that matched the request parameters.

post.description: This updates the key data for multiple zones at once. Keep in mind that this operation can only add zones to a TSIG key, not remove them. target.description: For `ALIAS` zones only. The name of the zone whose configuration this zone copies.

secret.description: A Base64-encoded string of data. When decoded, it needs to contain the correct number of bits for the chosen algorithm. If the input isn't correctly padded, the server applies the padding.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

post.description: Submits a request to delete one or more new Zones asynchronously. The request body contains a JSON array. Each element in the array is the name of a zone to be deleted.  Before deleting a zone from the Edge DNS system, the API makes sure Akamai servers aren't receiving DNS requests for that zone. It also checks that the zone isn't currently delegated to Akamai's name servers.  An offline task deletes the new zones. The result of this operation is a `requestId`, which you can use to check the task's status and view its results once it completes.

alerts.description: A set of existing problems with the current DNSSEC configuration, any of these values: `INCOMPATIBLE_AUTHORITIES`, `NON_AKAMAI_AUTHORITIES`, `PARENT_DS_MISSING`, `OLD_DNSKEY`, and `WRONG_DNSKEY`.

dsRecord.description: The generated DS record for this zone.

expectedTtl.description: The TTL on the NS record for this zone. This should match the TTL on the DS or DNSKEY record.

lastModifiedDate.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp on which these records were generated.

newRecords.description: The newly generated set of DNSSEC records, if one exists.

dnskeyRecord.description: The generated DNSKEY record for this zone.

dsRecord.description: The generated DS record for this zone.

expectedTtl.description: The TTL on the NS record for this zone. This should match the TTL on the DS or DNSKEY record.

lastModifiedDate.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp on which these records were generated.

post.description: Returns the results of the most recent zone transfer attempts for one or more zones.  When you configure a `SECONDARY` zone, several Akamai name servers known as zone transfer agents perform zone transfer requests to fetch the record data from the zone's configured master name servers. The data returned by this operation describes the results of those zone transfers.

actionType.description: __Read-only__ The type of action performed. `SOA` indicates that the agent tried to fetch the SOA record for this zone. `XFR` indicates that the agent attempted to perform a full zone transfer.

lastFailureTimestamp.description: __Read-only__ If present, the ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the most recent failed action occurred.

lastSuccessSerial.description: __Read-only__ If present, the SOA serial of the zone file at the time of the most recent successful retrieval.

lastSuccessTimestamp.description: __Read-only__ If present, the ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the most recent successful action occurred.

messages.description: Error messages logged by the zone transfer agents. May contain messages from previous, that is not the most recent, actions.

errorCode.description: __Read-only__ A short identifier for the problem.

timestamp.description: __Read-only__ The ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the error occurred.

agentIP.description: __Read-only__ The IP address of the Akamai zone transfer agent.

lastFailureTimestamp.description: __Read-only__ The ISO 8601 timestamp indicating the last time a zone transfer failed for this agent.

metadata.description: Information about the most recent successful and failed zone transfer attempt.

lastFailureTimestamp.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the most recent failed zone transfer occurred.

lastSuccessSerial.description: The SOA serial number that was read during the most recent successful zone transfer.

lastSuccessTimestamp.description: The ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the most recent successful zone transfer occurred.

schema.description: An Edge DNS zone. This object contains zone settings, but not record sets.

activationState.description: The current status of zone activation, either `NEW`, `PENDING_APPROVAL`, `ACTIVE`, `OBSOLETE`, `LOCKED`, or `ERROR`.

aliasCount.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. The number of zones of type `ALIAS` that point to this zone.

endCustomerId.description: Free-form user identifier for this zone, often used by resellers.

lastActivationDate.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the latest version was activated.

lastModifiedBy.description: The name of the user that last edited this zone.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the zone was last modified.

masters.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The names or addresses of the customer's name servers from which the zone data should be retrieved.

signAndServe.description: Whether DNSSEC Sign&Serve is enabled. Applies to `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only.

signAndServeAlgorithm.description: The algorithm currently or last used for DNSSEC Sign&Serve, either `RSA_SHA1`, `RSA_SHA256`, `RSA_SHA512`, `ECDSA_P256_SHA256`, or `ECDSA_P384_SHA384`. Absent if no algorithm has ever been assigned to this zone.

subzoneGrants.description: Determines if cross-account subzones are enabled. This doesn't impact the ability to create subzones that you're presently authorized to edit.

target.description: For `ALIAS` zones only. The name of the zone whose configuration this zone copies.

tsigKey.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The TSIG key used for zone transfers.

algorithm.description: The algorithm used to encode the TSIG key's secret data. Possible values are: `hmac-md5`, `hmac-sha1`, `hmac-sha224`, `hmac-sha256`, `hmac-sha384`, `hmac-sha512`, or `HMAC-MD5.SIG-ALG.REG.INT`.

name.description: The name of the TSIG key. This is a name that's unique across all of Akamai's customers. Since the key name is treated like a DNS name, the value is lowercase and the server removes any trailing dots.

secret.description: A Base64-encoded string of data. When decoded, it needs to contain the correct number of bits for the chosen algorithm. If the input isn't correctly padded, the server applies the padding.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

type.description: The zone type. A `PRIMARY` zone's records are stored in Control Center. A `SECONDARY` zone's records are stored on the customer's name servers. `ALIAS` zones allow users to duplicate the configuration of an existing zone.

versionId.description: The UUID of the most recently activated version. You can use this value as an `ETag` when performing operations that affect zones.

put.description: Modifies a zone. You can't change the zone `type` with this operation.

endCustomerId.description: Free-form user identifier for this zone, often used by resellers.

lastActivationDate.description: For `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only. An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the latest version was activated.

lastModifiedBy.description: The name of the user that last edited this zone.

lastModifiedDate.description: An ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the zone was last modified.

masters.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The names or addresses of the customer's name servers from which the zone data should be retrieved.

signAndServe.description: Whether DNSSEC Sign&Serve is enabled. Applies to `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones only.

signAndServeAlgorithm.description: The algorithm currently or last used for DNSSEC Sign&Serve, either `RSA_SHA1`, `RSA_SHA256`, `RSA_SHA512`, `ECDSA_P256_SHA256`, or `ECDSA_P384_SHA384`. Absent if no algorithm has ever been assigned to this zone.

subzoneGrants.description: Determines if cross-account subzones are enabled. This doesn't impact the ability to create subzones that you're presently authorized to edit.

target.description: For `ALIAS` zones only. The name of the zone whose configuration this zone copies.

tsigKey.description: For `SECONDARY` zones only. The TSIG key used for zone transfers.

algorithm.description: The algorithm used to encode the TSIG key's secret data. Possible values are: `hmac-md5`, `hmac-sha1`, `hmac-sha224`, `hmac-sha256`, `hmac-sha384`, `hmac-sha512`, or `HMAC-MD5.SIG-ALG.REG.INT`.

name.description: The name of the TSIG key. This is a name that's unique across all of Akamai's customers. Since the key name is treated like a DNS name, the value is lowercase and the server removes any trailing dots.

secret.description: A Base64-encoded string of data. When decoded, it needs to contain the correct number of bits for the chosen algorithm. If the input isn't correctly padded, the server applies the padding.

zonesCount.description: The number of zones that reference this key.

type.description: The zone type. A `PRIMARY` zone's records are stored in Control Center. A `SECONDARY` zone's records are stored on the customer's name servers. `ALIAS` zones allow users to duplicate the configuration of an existing zone.

versionId.description: The UUID of the most recently activated version. You can use this value as an `ETag` when performing operations that affect zones.

parameters.description: The name of the zone.
parameters.name: zone

get.description: Displays the [difference](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-dns/reference/get-zone-versions-diff) between any two versions of a zone, as specified in the query parameters.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS API

parameters.description: UUID for the base version.
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: UUID of version to diff against base version.
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

schema.description: A report on the difference between two zone versions or a version and a change list.

diffs.description: Collections of differences between the two versions.

recordSetDiffs.description: Record sets that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a record set between two versions.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value doesn't exist on an `ADD` difference.

name.description: The name of the record set that changed.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference contains the `toValue` but not a `fromValue`. A `DELETE` difference is the other way around. An `EDIT` difference has both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value doesn't exist on an `DELETE` difference.

type.description: The type of the record set that changed.

settingsDiffs.description: Settings fields that have changed between two versions.

items.description: The difference in a settings value between two versions.

fieldName.description: The name of the settings value that changed.

fromValue.description: The prior value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value isn't present for an `ADD` difference.

operation.description: The type of difference. An `ADD` difference contains the `toValue` and a `DELETE` difference contains a `fromValue`. An `EDIT` difference contains both fields.

toValue.description: The new value of the settings field or record set. This may be any type of data, depending on the field that changed. The value isn't present for a `DELETE` difference.

metadata.description: Metadata about this diff report, describing the versions being diffed.

fromVersionId.description: The version ID of the base version.

fromVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the base version was last modified.

toVersionId.description: The version ID of the new version or change list.

toVersionLastModifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the new change list version was last modified.

parameters.description: The name of the zone.
parameters.name: zone

get.description: Lists all record sets for this zone. It works only for `PRIMARY` and `SECONDARY` zones. This operation [paginates](https://techdocs.akamai.com/edge-dns/reference/use-pagination).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Edge DNS API

parameters.description: Sorts the list on the specified fields. You can specify multiple fields as a comma-separated list. Placing a dash before a field name sorts it in descending order. Allowed fields include `name` and `type`.
parameters.name: sortBy

parameters.description: Displays only record sets that match one of the provided types. Specifies multiple fields as a comma-separated list. Ignores illegal or disallowed record types.
parameters.name: types

parameters.description: Display only record sets whose RDATA field matches this value. The entire record set, that is all records with the same name and type, displays if any record in the set has RDATA that matches the supplied value.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: Which page of results to return. The first page is page `1`, the default value.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The number of results per page to return, `25` by default.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Disables paging and shows the entire list all at once, `false` by default. Using this parameter may significantly increase the time required to respond to the request.
parameters.name: showAll

The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

pageSize.description: The number of results per page.

types.description: Reflects the set of record types that were requested.

items.description: A set of one or more resource records that share the same name, type, and TTL.

name.description: The fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of this record.

rdata.description: Each string encodes the rdata for a single record. If you want to have three A records, you need three strings in the array. Each string is encoded in master file format. RFC 1035 defines master file format for most record types.

ttl.description: The number of seconds that this record should live in a resolver's cache before being refetched.

type.description: The record type.

post.description: Create and activate a new version of the zone by copying the record sets from a prior version of this zone and reapplying them to the current version. The new version has a new, auto-incremented SOA serial number, and the zone's modification data is set to the current time and user. All other zone settings remain the same as the current version.

get.summary: Get a version's master zone file

parameters.description: A UUID indicating a zone version tag.
parameters.name: uuid

parameters.description: The name of the zone.
parameters.name: zone

post.description: Upload new record set data for this zone in master zone file format. Replaces any existing record sets. This operation applies to primary zones and secondary zones. See [RFC 1035](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1035) section 5 and [RFC 1034](http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1034) section 3.6.1 for more information.  Zone files can contain only US-ASCII characters 0–127. Where allowed, you can encode high-order ASCII characters, 128+, with a backslash plus a three-digit decimal number representing the byte value. For example, `\233` instead of `é`.  `AKAMAICDN` and `AKAMAITLC` records can't be represented in this format. Uploading a zone file doesn't affect these records.
